feed.title: Plans to separate wallet from core

entry.title: Plans to separate wallet from core
entry.summary: BitcoinJ lacks a quick and easy way to set up a wallet as a daemon for non-Java functionality through RPC. While most users are content with using it as a library, a mostly Core-compatible JSON-RPC frontend would be desirable. The lack of C++ and PHP support is notable, but popular languages like JavaScript, Python 2.7, Lisp, and Ruby can be used alongside less well-known ones. JSON-RPC support would also enable the reuse of Core regression tests.
